intro: Hyalosperma simplex subsp. simplex, commonly known as the slender glassy grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that are typically green or pale in color. It is native to Australia and thrives in dry, sandy soils. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
